attr.name: format
attr.p: The format to encode the image to. The formats available are:

c.p: Graphics Interchange Format (might be missing in your roxen)
Joint Photography Expert Group image compression
Advanced Visual Systems Inc. image format
HRZ is (was?) used for amatuer radio slow-scan TV.

attr.name: quant
attr.p: The number of colors to quantizize the image to.
Default for gif is 32(+1 transparent), for most other formats (except black and white) is it unlimited.

attr.name: dither
attr.p: Choose the dithering method.

c.p: No dithering is performed at all.
Random scatter dither. Not visually pleasing, but it is useful for very high resolution printing.
Error diffusion dithering. Usually the best dithering method.

attr.name: true-alpha
attr.p: If present, render a real alpha channel instead of on/off alpha. If the file format only supports on/off alpha, the alpha channel is dithered using a floyd-steinberg dither.

attr.name: background-color
attr.p: The color to render the image against.

attr.name: opaque-value
attr.p: The transparency value to use, 100 is fully opaque, and 0 is fully transparent.

attr.name: cs-rgb-hsv
attr.p: Perform rgb to hsv colorspace conversion.

attr.name: gamma
attr.p: Perform gamma adjustment.

attr.name: cs-grey
attr.p: Perform rgb to greyscale colorspace conversion.

attr.name: cs-invert
attr.p: Invert all colors

attr.name: cs-hsv-rgb
attr.p: Perform hsv to rgb colorspace conversion.

attr.name: rotate-cw
attr.p: Rotate the image clock-wise.

attr.name: rotate-ccw
attr.p: Rotate the image counter clock-wise.

attr.name: rotate-unit
attr.p: Select the unit to use while rotating.

attr.name: mirror-x
attr.p: Mirror the image around the X-axis.

attr.name: mirror-y
attr.p: Mirror the image around the Y-axis.

attr.name: scale
attr.p: Scale fact times. (0.5 -> half size, 2.0 -> double size)

attr.name: scale
attr.p: Scale to the exact size x,y. If either of X or Y is zero, the image is scaled to the specified width or hight, and the value that is zero is scaled in proportion to the other value.

attr.name: max-width
attr.p: If width is larger than 'xsize', scale width to 'xsize' while keeping aspect.

attr.name: max-height
attr.p: If height is larger than 'ysize', scale height to 'ysize' while keeping aspect.

attr.name: span-width
attr.p: If width is larger than 'xsize', scale width to 'xsize' while keeping aspect. If width is smaller than 'xsize', extend width to 'xsize' by filling the new space with current background color.

attr.name: span-height
attr.p: If height is larger than 'ysize', scale height to 'ysize' while keeping aspect. If height is smaller than 'ysize', extend height to 'ysize' by filling the new space with current background color.

attr.name: x-offset
attr.p: Cut n pixels from the beginning of the X scale.

attr.name: y-offset
attr.p: Cut n pixels from the beginning of the Y scale.

attr.name: x-size
attr.p: Keep n pixels from the beginning of the X scale.

attr.name: y-size
attr.p: Keep n pixels from the beginning of the Y scale.

attr.name: crop
attr.p: Crops the image by using several differen methods. The simplest is to only specify the area to be cropped with x,y-x,y coordinates. By instead selecting "auto" the image will be cropped so that as many pixels as possible with the same color is removed from around the image.

A more advanced cropping method can be used by giving the crop argument "guides-cross". The image will then be cropped around the intersection of two guides inside the image. Guides can be added to e.g. Photoshop and GIMP images. If several guides are present, which ones to use can be selected with the guides-index=x,y attribute, where x and y is the number of the guides. Guides cross cropping is usefull together with max-width and max-height attributes when creating thumb nails.

A combination of guides cross cropping can be used by giving the crop argument "guides-region". In this cropping mode the area enclosed by two horizontal and two vertical guides are saved. Which guides to use is given by the guides-index=x1,y1-x2,y2 attribute, where the x and y parameters are the number of the guides. Guides can also be specified as guides-index=x,y. Then the saved area will be the one enclosed by the buides x,y and x+1,y+1, counting from left and top. Again, combine max-width and max-height makes a good effect, since scaling is performed after cropping.

attr.name: jpeg-quality
attr.p: Set the quality on the output jpeg image.

attr.name: jpeg-optimize
attr.p: If 0, do not generate optimal tables. Somewhat faster, but produces bigger files.

attr.name: jpeg-progressive=
attr.p: Generate progressive jpeg images.

attr.name: jpeg-smooth
attr.p: Smooth the image while compressing it. This produces smaller files, but might undo the effects of dithering.

attr.name: bmp-bpp
attr.p: Force this number of bits per pixel for bmp images.

attr.name: bmp-windows
attr.p: Windows or OS/2 mode, default is 1. (windows mode)

attr.name: bmp-rle
attr.p: RLE 'compress' the BMP image.

attr.name: gd-alpha_index
attr.p: Color in the colormap to make transparent for GD-images with alpha channel.

attr.name: pcx-raw
attr.p: If 1, do not RLE encode the PCX image.

attr.name: pcx-dpy
attr.p: Resolution, in pixels per inch.

attr.name: pcx-xdpy
attr.p: Resolution, in pixels per inch.

attr.name: pcx-ydpy
attr.p: Resolution, in pixels per inch.

attr.name: pcx-xoffset
attr.p: Offset from start of image data to image content for PCX images. Unused by most programs.

attr.name: pcx-yoffset
attr.p: Offset from start of image data to image content for PCX images. Unused by most programs.

attr.name: tga-raw
attr.p: If 1, do not RLE encode the Targa image.

attr.name: ps-dpi
attr.p: Dots per inch for the resulting postscript file.
